issue.title: [C++][Dataset] Ensure that dataset code is robust to schemas with duplicate field names
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-7412](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7412). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Fields in a schema don't have to have unique names, so we should make sure we're not assuming that.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7412?focusedCommentId=17009057) by Ben Kietzman (bkietz):*
For now, we should probably just error if a field is referenced whose name is not unique.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7412?focusedCommentId=17039101) by Ben Kietzman (bkietz):*
A more general solution would be provide an unambiguous way to refer to fields https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-aoAb1d00BfCcEP--kmYWDBb_eeOFgtlSVPPjSGy8ko/edit

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7412?focusedCommentId=17059133) by Ben Kietzman (bkietz):*
Issue resolved by pull request 6545
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6545>
